con:part.con:content:
InstitutionCode: 3 or 4 digit code indicating the Institution being used

StationID: The ID of the terminal/machine being used

StaffID: The ID of the employee submitting the request. Valid ID required for resetPIN.

EnvBranch: Branch Code indicating the Branch being used; required for CheckInItem, CheckoutItem, and createSuggestion. Can be used optionally with getPatronSummaryOverview to limit counts returned to transactions associated with items held by, or fines and fees written at, the given Branch code. Default behavior, if the EnvBranch is excluded, is to return counts for all transactions.

DebugMode: Whether or not the request should be submitted in debug mode

ReportMode: Whether or not the request should be submitted in report mode; implemented and required for CheckInItem, CheckOutItem, and updatePatronUserDefinedFields. If True, information about the attempted transaction will be returned, but the transaction will not be completed. If False, the transaction will be completed.

Projection: The level of detail for each result in the response

RequestOrigin: The feature from which the request was initiated; required for UpdateItem. Limited to 12 characters

]]> This element contains the different levels of detail available for certain results (such as Title or Branch)<br/><br/> Retrieve the complete detail for each result in the response Retrieve a subset of the detail for each result in the response Retrieve a small, optimized subset of details for web performance
StartPos: Beginning location within the result set where records should be returned (ie if the result set contains 50 records, return the records beginning with the 10th record). Cannot be used in conjunction with FollowOnBrowseToken

FollowOnBrowseToken: When conducting follow-on browses, this token specifies the next block of results to return. Cannot be used in conjunction with StartPos

NoOfRecords: The maximum number of results to return in the response
]]>
Code: A numeric code indicating whether a request was successful or not

Severity: The level of importance of the response status

ShortMessage: A brief description of the response status

LongMessage: A more detailed description of the response status (optional)

Resolution: A message indicating what actions must be taken to fix an invalid/failed request

]]>
StartPos: The start position of the results (if supplied in the request)

FollowOnBrowseToken: The token required to retrieve the next block of results for a follow-on browse

NoOfRecords: The number of results contained in the response

MoreRecords: A boolean indicating if additional results are available

TotalHits: The total number of records returned by a query (the response typically contains a subset of the total number of records found)
EstimatedTotalHits: The estimated total number of records returned by a query

BID: The bid

ModDate: The last modified date of the corresponding bid

Media: Numeric value of the Media associated with an Item.

Status: Status code of an item. Status codes available include: S = On Shelf, ST = On Shelf Temporary, SP = In Process, SG = Damaged, SM = Missing, SW = Withdrawn, SX = Not on Shelf, SC = Custom Status 1, SU = Custom Status 2, SS = Custom Status 3, SO = Custom Status 4, SI = Display, SD = Shelving Delay, C = Charged to patron (includes overdue and lost), CT = Charged Temporary, L = A9/Lost, LT = Lost Temporary, I = In Transit, IT = In Transit Temporary, H = Hold Shelf, HT = Hold Shelf Temporary, IH = Hold in Transit, T = Traced. Note that items currently in a transactional status cannot have their status updated via this method.

Call Number: Item Call Number.

Manually Suppressed: Whether or not an item is manually suppressed, where True = Suppressed and False = Not Manually Suppressed.

Bucket: A list of Bucket data associated with the item. Each item can have up to four bucket entries, each of which consists of three elements.
Position: The position of hierarchical data fields. Available positions are 1 - 4.
Label: The field label associated with the selected bucket position.
Data: The data associated with the selected bucket position.

Chronology: Date of an issue or Item. Available options are, Seasonal, Month/Day/Year, Year, Month/Year.

Hemisphere: Enumerated value indicating the hemisphere of the publication. Available values include: Northern or Southern
Year: Restricted string indicating the year of publication. Must be four digits between 0000-9999.
MonthDayYear: Use for items with a Month, Day, Year publication pattern.
Month: Restricted string indicating the month of publication. Must be two digits between 01-12.
Day: Restricted string indicating the month of publication. Must be two digits between 01-31
Year: Use for items that are published yearly.
Year: Restricted string indicating the year of publication. Must be four digits between 0000-9999.
MonthYear: Use for items with a Month and Year publication pattern only.
Year: Restricted string indicating the year of publication. Must be four digits between 0000-9999
Month: Restricted string indicating the month of publication. Must be two digits between 01-12.

Enumeration: Enumeration data associated with the item, which consists of the following elements:
Position: Restricted string indicating the position of the enumerated value. Available positions are 1-4.
Label: The field label associated with the selected Enumeration position.
Data: Restricted string indicating the data associated with the selected bucket position. Entry limited to 10 characters.

Alternate Shelf Status: Alternate status information about the item that staff may use to communication information about the item in lieu of (or in addition to) the validated status codes and their descriptions.

Reserve Media: Not currently implemented.

Rotate Flag: Not currently implemented.

Reserve Branch: Not currently implemented.

Reserve Location: Not currently implemented.

Reserve Type: Not currently implemented.

Branch: Valid branch code from the BRANCH table. Included in the Brief and Full Projection

Location: Valid location code from the LOCATION table. Included in the Brief and Full Projection

Media: Valid media number from the MEDIA table. Included in the Brief and Full Projection

CN: Item-level call number, variously derived. Included in Full Projection only

Status Date: Date the item's status changed. Included in the Brief and Full Projection

BID: Unique Bibliographic record ID number. Included in the Brief and Full Projection

Circ History: Number of times item has been charged/renewed since counter last re-set. Included in the Brief and Full Projection

Cumulative History: Number of times item has been charged/renewed since its creation. Included in the Brief and Full Projection

In House Circ: Number of times item has been returned with an on shelf status since counter last re-set. Included in the Brief and Full Projection

Holds History: # of times item has gone to Hold Shelf status since counter set. Included in Brief and Full Projection

Title: Title of a work, usually from the Bib 245 tag. Included in Brief and Full Projection

Author: Author of a work, from the Bib 100 tag. Included in Brief and Full Projection

Occur: Unique occurrence number. Included in Full Projection only

OwningBranch: Numeric value of owning branch. Included in Full Projection only

OwningLocation: Numeric value of owning location. Included in Full Projection only

ReserveLoanPeriod: Valid Reserve loan period from the RLP file. Included in Full Projection only

ReserveMedia: Valid Reserve media type value from the RTY file. Included in Full Projection only

DueDate: (Tandem Julian Timestamp) Date the item is due or not needed. Included in Full Projection only

Notes: Indicates whether a patron has note(s) attached; must be either "*" or blank. Included in Full Projection only

Type: Indicates whether an item record originated in Circulation or Acquisitions. Included in Full Projection only

EditDate: Date the item was last edited. Included in Full Projection only

UserID: Logon alias of staff who last edited item. Included in Full Projection only

Branch1: Valid branch value from the BRA file. Included in Full Projection only

CreationDate: Date the item record was created (converted). Included in Full Projection only

InstBit: Numeric code from Institution table. Included in Full Projection only

ISID: Issue set ID number references ISSUESET table. Included in Full Projection only

Suppress: Y/N: Hidden item. Included in Full Projection only

ReserveBranch: Branch of reserve item. Included in Full Projection only

ReserveLocation: Location of reserve item. Included in Full Projection only

ReserveType: Type of item; 0 - regular, 1-reserve, 2- reserve only. Included in Full Projection only

ReserveCN: Call Number of Reserve Item. Variously derived. Included in Full Projection only

Folder: Number representing a particular collection of records for an institution. Included in Full Projection only

CallNumberFull: Call number of a work, variously derived. Included in the Brief and Full Projection

PublicationDate: Date of publication of title. Included in Full Projection only

Language: Language of the work. Included in Full Projection only

RecordType: Bytes 6 and 7 of the bibliographic leader. Included in Full Projection only

TitleIndicators: Indicator field from title tag. Included in Full Projection only

BibType: Flag indicating if the title is full (0) or temporary (1). Included in Full Projection only

HiddenType: Flag indicating whether to display the bib record (0 = show; 1 = hide). Included in Full Projection only

AcqType: Acquisitions type (0 = Book in house; 1 = Book on order). Included in Full Projection only

ISBN: International Standard Book Number. Included in Full Projection only

BibSuppressDate: Date through which to Suppress display of the bib record. Included in Full Projection only

BibSuppressType: Flag indicating under what conditions to set the HiddenType flag (0 = auto, 1 = manual, 2 = through date, 3 = for no item, 4 = never). Included in Full Projection only

UPC: Universal Product Code for title, from 024 tag. Included in Full Projection only

BibLatestChange: Time of latest change to bib record. Included in Full Projection only

ItemsLatestChange: Time of latest change to items on bib record. Included in Full Projection only

eResource: 'Y' or 'N'. Indicates if a bid is an eresource or not. Included in Full Projection only
]]> Status: Current status: S = On Shelf, ST = Shelf Temp Item, C = Charged to patron (includes odue and lost),CT = Charge Temp Item, L = A9/Lost, LT = A9/Lost temp, I = In Transit, IT = In transit Temp Item, H = Hold Shelf, HT = Hold Shelf Temp, IH = Hold In Transit, T = Traced <br/><br/>
Archived: Indicates whether or not the status is Archived, and not available for use: Y = archived; N = not archived.

Load: Indicates whether or not the status is available to use when Loading items: Y = available; N = not available.

Shelf: Indicates whether or not the status is available when editing items: Y = available; N = not available

Suppressed: Indicates whether or not the status is automatically suppressed: Y = suppressed; N = not suppressed.

Type: Only statuses with blank (or null) should be returned.

Admin: Indicates whether or not the status is displayed in CARL.X Administration>Application Parameters>Public Access>Item Statuses tab: Y = displayed; N = not displayed.

Response also includes a follow on token for paging, as well as "Titles For Heading" tokens. Returns an alphabetical listing of name headings showing the number of bibliographic records for each heading as well as authority information. Personal names must be searched with surname first. Response also includes a follow on token for paging, as well as "Titles For Heading" tokens. Returns a list of bibliographic records sorted by title-level call number, starting with the call number searched (or the call number following closest). For Call Number searches set up to search specific call number types (i.e. Dewey Abridged, Dewey Unabridged, LC, Gov Docs), returns a list of bibliographic records sorted by specific call number, starting with the call number searched (or the call number following closest). For Call Number searches set up to search specific call number types (i.e. Dewey Abridged, Dewey Unabridged, LC, Gov Docs), returns a list of bibliographic records sorted by specific call number, starting with the call number searched (or the call number following closest). For Call Number searches set up to search specific call number types (i.e. Dewey Abridged, Dewey Unabridged, LC, Gov Docs), returns a list of bibliographic records sorted by specific call number, starting with the call number searched (or the call number following closest). For Call Number searches set up to search specific call number types (i.e. Dewey Abridged, Dewey Unabridged, LC, Gov Docs), returns a list of bibliographic records sorted by specific call number, starting with the call number searched (or the call number following closest). Returns a list of bibliographic records sorted by item-level call number, starting with the call number searched (or the call number following closest). Returns an alphabetical listing of series headings showing the number of bibliographic records for each heading as well as authority information. Response also includes a follow on token for paging, as well as "Titles For Heading" tokens. Returns an alphabetical listing of subject headings showing the number of bibliographic records for each heading as well as authority information. Response also includes a follow on token for paging, as well as "Titles For Heading" tokens. Returns a list of bibliographic records sorted by title, starting with the phrase searched (or the title following closest to the phrase searched). Searches the CARL BID (Bibliographic Identifier), the unique number assigned to a bibliographic record as it enters your CARL database. Quick Search Commands are available for all search types and can be used to bypass the selection of a Search Type. Searches ISBN data from bibliographic tag 020 and Acquisitions orders. Searches ISSN data from bibliographic tag 022 and Acquisitions orders. Searches all words that appear in bibliographic records. Searches LCCN data from bibliographic tag 010. Searches number data in bibliographic records, including OCLC Control Number. Searches words in name headings without regard to word order. Returns an alphabetical list of headings showing the number of associated bibliographic records, authority information, and "Titles For Heading" tokens. Searches words from name headings, combined with words from bibliographic records. Searches words in series headings without regard to word order. Returns a list of bibliographic records where the search terms entered are found in a Series Heading that has been indexed for searching. Searches words in series headings without regard to word order. Returns an alphabetical list of those headings showing the number of associated bibliographic records, authority information and "Titles For Heading" tokens. Searches words in subject headings without regard to word order. Returns a list of bibliographic records where the search terms entered are found in a Subject Heading that has been indexed for searching. Searches words in subject headings without regard to word order. Returns an alphabetical list of those headings showing the number of associated bibliographic records, authority information, and "Titles For Heading" tokens. Searches title data in bibliographic records without regard to word order. Utilizing a token generated by searches that lead to authority data, retrieves bibliographic records associated with a given authority record.
